items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Tide locking, where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible today, Wednesday 29th October. 
We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning. Neap tides with a small tidal surge mean that the low tides are not very low, restricting drainage and preventing water levels in the Broads to drop more quickly. We expect levels to start returning to normal soon. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 30 October 2025 or as the situation changes.
